brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts LAN cabling areas as follows:

Work Area: A PC connects to an RJ-45 wall jack using a patch cable.

Horizontal Cabling: Cabling is run from the RJ-45 jack to a patch panel in the telecommunications room.

Telecommunications Room: UTP cabling connects the patch panel to a switch.

Backbone Cabling: UTP or fiber cabling is run from the switch in the telecommunications room to other telecommunication rooms.
